snippet: The story of Armida and Rinaldo was an operatic favorite of the 17th and 18th centuries. The Juilliard School will present a semi-staged version of Gluck’s telling, “Armide.”
abstract: Julliard School is presenting a semi-staged version of Gluck opera Armide, which was performed only seven times at the Metropolitan Opera from 1910 to 1912; story on which it is based, a popular Italian epic, was an operatic favorite of the 17th and 18th centuries.
lead_paragraph: The story of Armida and Rinaldo was an operatic favorite of the 17th and 18th centuries. The Juilliard School will present a semi-staged version of Gluck’s telling, “Armide.”

headline.seo: Tellings of Armida’s Story, Including Gluck’s at Juilliard
